intro: Fumaria acaulis, commonly known as the slender fumewort, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stem and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Fumaria acaulis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in gardens or along roadsides.
